author: pepperbf94
title: Excellent treatment
body: Excellent care. I have been attending for four months following routine checks found I had a problem. I was referred to the Rainworth centre – Joanna is brilliant, knows what she is doing, kept me informed throughout and provisions are in place for the future.

author: Alf66
title: A credit to the care sector
body:
My care worker Mr Ali is excellent. He makes me feel listened to. He showed compassion, understanding of my needs and he was very easy to talk to.  
Mr Ali gave me hope again in the care sector. He is very reliable and he would always contact me and on visits was always on time.  
He helped me with other services that I will benefit from.  
Overall Mr Ali is a credit in the care sector.  
[Unsure about 'Seeing the whole me']  
  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']

author: jupitertj98
title: Out of hours covid support
body:
After testing positive for Covid and being on the vulnerable list I completed the NHS provided test and reported the positive result via the government website.  
I was contacted by the out of hour’s support team. Who couldn’t have been more helpful, their support and advice made me feel much more relaxed about having Covid.  
Because of my kidney condition I was unable to have the antiviral medication. They, however sent me an Oximeter device with which I could monitor my blood/oxygen levels.  
This was followed up every couple of days with telephone calls to check on my progress and to offer more useful advice.  
Absolutely fantastic service and do grateful for all the help and advice.  
All of the nurses were so kind and caring and knowledgeable.  
Thank you all so much.

author: Mett
title: Care for my terminally ill husband
body:
I was extremely concerned when my soulmate shown signs of weight loss and continuous coughing, difficulty swallowing. A call from our regular GP was arranged and got it same day. The GP spoke with the patient and actually diagnosed what he thought it could be, and wasted no time. He had a chest x ray that morning and then referred him the same day for full body scan.  
It turned out that our GP was absolutely correct with the diagnosis he made from knowing the patient and his expertise as a GP. From that day Dr Danaher was there anytime we needed advice or simply just someone with outstanding knowledge to talk to. My husband was admitted for the tests to confirm extent and stage of cancer, but once that was done I asked he was discharged home where he was happy and comfortable. It was the support of our GP that kept us both going and caring for my husband myself in our own home came from the courage I gained from our GP. He was always on hand to give me advise when I was uncertain if I was giving the best care if it was something I knew nothing about.  
I was immensely grateful I had Dr Danaher to turn to for advice. He often spoke on phone with my husband, with full empathy, compassion, kindness and understanding. He knew how to chat with my husband and I noticed after a call with Dr Danaher he would be smiling and happy. This was down to a dedicated doctor. We both felt blessed to have him at such a crucial sad time in the life we shared together.  
I would question whether I giving the right care at home neither of us wanted any hospital admission if could be avoided. Our home is where we shared our life’s together and this is where we both wanted to continue to share our last months together. Dr Danaher would reassure me I was doing a great job and I’d turn to him for his advice on anything that could help. Nothing was ever to much trouble for our dr ,he’d be straight onto anything needed immediately .from food supplement drinks to medication just anything he thought may be of help he would have it sorted immediately.  
My husband lived for 5 months after diagnosis. His hospital consultant was equally as kind but didn’t know us as our doctor soes but still she arranged hospital bed and other essential equipment on same day I said David can no longer make the stairs safely and was too weak to try again. She was compassionate kind and caring thanks to our doctor I managed to care full time for David in our own home where we’d shared the love, laughter, tears joy and pain together.  
With my ongoing struggle of poor mental health and GAD it was at times so overwhelming on me I’d again turn to Dr Danaher for support. I was always given as much time as I needed to talk. It is now 18 months on and I still get the support when needed from Dr Danaher. He has a true passion for his role as a doctor and it shines through that he does this job out of passion to help patients. I can honestly say knowing I have got Dr Danaher to talk to has a huge positive affect on my mental health. I really don’t know how I’d be today without the knowledge that he is at hand when things become too overwhelming for me. I feel all his patients are truly blessed to have a GP that cares so much and goes well above and beyond his call of duty.  
As a GP his patients are his prime concern he’s simply one in a million. I just only wish there was a way of forwarding him for a GP award - he most certainly deserves to be recognised for the quality of patient care he gives. I will be forever thankful to him for the kindness compassion and time he gave to us and my husband would certainly agree with all I say.  
Nor is he wrong with the diagnoses he makes on my health issues which are very complex and challenging but Dr Danaher never fails to get correct diagnosis. Trust is something I struggle badly with when it comes to my health but I can honestly say I never doubt Dr Danaher  
I’d really like you to recognise the dedication this GP gives to his patients and if possible forward him for a dedicated patient GP award. I have spent time searching how I could do this but to no avail.

author: Mrs R66
title: They do a great job and the calls are very useful
body:
My blood pressure had been really high and I had been feeling dizzy, I used to go to physiotherapy where it was picked up that my blood pressure was abnormally high. They then stopped my physiotherapy and started monitoring my blood pressure at home. This was done via a daily phone call - this I would receive daily as they monitored it to keep an eye on my health and blood pressure.  
My blood pressure has now started to fluctuate, having more good and normal days but with the odd abnormally high days. My daily calls have now reduced to 2 time a week to monitor my blood pressure.  
They do a great job and the calls are very useful.

author: Fedqq36
title: A big thank you
body:
After waiting over 40 minutes on the phone, I was very grateful with the service provided by my GP surgery when I needed an emergency appointment for my child.  
A big thank you to all the staff at Upperthorpe Medical Centre.

title: Phone appt
body:
A very helpful chat with GP. 
The GP listened well and gave helpful suggestions. I felt the GP understood where I was coming from and she did not appear to rush the appointment. 
The GP followed up the appointment by text with more information for me.

title: Fantastic practice nurse
body:
I have liaised with one of the practice nurses on a couple of occasions recently and then had a consultation with her. 
She is extremely polite, friendly and knowledgeable. 
She went above and beyond for me. Although she is a nurse, she has a “being human” nature to her which made me feel very at eased. 
She is a credit to the surgery and if / when I need advice again, I will be asking for her.

title: Great Doctor (You know who you are)
body:
I've always complained if I find fault, its the only way to improve things  and in the present day there is so much that isn't working so  in fairness if I get good service I like to say.
Today once again I had a positive experience with the doctor who took his time to listen to me and discuss at length my health. The was no rushing, he made me very comfortable and answered all my questions. I came away very happy. Thankyou.

title: Quality and speedy service
body:
Telephone booking arranged very quickly and got what I needed in a clear and concise way.
Recommend this surgery and GP.

title: Excellent practice
body: On my last visit, member of staff was kind, polite, friendly. Information given was thorough and professional, thank you.

title: Excellent service
body: This surgery is so busy, they serve a large area and have a lot of patients, however they always provide excellent service and really take care of their patients. When things are serious they go above and beyond to make sure their patients are cared for, we have only ever had great experiences with the surgery, particularly in their care of our children.

title: Amazing Care
body: Suffering with an ongoing health issues that was suspected to have underlying reasons, Avonside have not given up on me and have, where appropriate, referred me for specialist advice. Their understanding and dogged determination to find the root cause of my health condition has been so reassuring. I feel that, despite the pressures the NHS are facing, I still matter. Thank you all.

title: Outstanding Practice
body:
I hear a lot about how GP practices failing their patients. This one has compassionate, unfaltering, hardworking, dedicated people. They go the extra mile and make sure that they treat their patients like people. 
The visit I am reviewing I had to go in for face to face and it was difficult for me because I have complex PTSD and rarely saw people during Covid, I was put at ease treated with kindness and empathy, giving me the courage to discuss difficult issues. The visit was exceptional.

title: Great practice
body: Always friendly and helpful staff, particularly helpful reception team. Unwell at university could not get seen, came home to Ashingdon medical centre where I knew we would get "great care". Wonderful team! Thanks for everything

title: Outstanding Practice
body:
I hear a lot about how GP practices failing their patients. This one has compassionate, unfaltering, hardworking, dedicated people. They go the extra mile and make sure that they treat their patients like people. 
The visit I am reviewing I had to go in for face to face and it was difficult for me because I have complex PTSD and rarely saw people during Covid, I was put at ease treated with kindness and empathy, giving me the courage to discuss difficult issues. The visit was exceptional.

title: Best care possible
body: My husband had a heart attack a few days ago. The ambulance came in minutes. The catheter lab was ready for him on arrival. His clot was busted within minutes and stent placed. He was attended by consultants and amazing nurses all of whom couldn’t have done more to reassure me while I waited for him to come back onto the main ward. Amazing care. Thank you.

title: First class service
body: From reception through assessment and on to theatre I felt reassured and comfortable.  Totally professional service.

title: First Class
body:
From the moment of entry I knew I was in a caring, happy and loving environment. It felt safe. There was a pleasant smell. Folk were smiling, inviting and I was a stranger searching for a home for my mother. Residents were happy and chatting to each other. Some were singing in the corner led by a visiting entertainer. At last, after my great search I had found a home suitable for my darling mother. The Manager reassured me that her individual needs would be cared for and what was important, I believed her. Carers past me saying hello and smiling. I was led to a lovely vacant room which was to be my mother’s own room. Larger than I expected with everything there that she would need to keep her cared for and comfortable. I felt reassured again. Questions and answered flowed for quite some time. I was led out to the garden and terrace, “ Where you can arrange your private family gatherings” I was told. I actually felt excited and relieved. 
This I’m sure is the start of an adventure. Thank you God for bringing me here. Mam is going to love this.

title: Terrible place
body: Hopeless staff extremely noisy, the person I was visiting was freezing cold the staff well it seemed like it was more like a beano than a hospital. Send ing 1 person to change a wet and feaces pad and telling a dementia to roll over. This person does not understand about persons with dementia. How much training do your staff get. Yo my knowledge I know of 3 people that have died in this hospital. Due to unhelpness people are talking. Get all your staff trained to be helpful, friendly and willing to run a good ship!

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Best care from both Urology CNS - RLH
body:
Been attending the Urology Outpatients for the last few months, and have been truly well looked after by both Urology Clinical nurse specialists at The Royal London Hospital.  Their nursing care had be most outstanding and exceptional, cannot fault them at all. The fact that they’re both very approachable and kind and understanding , even at their busiest times, and ensuring they get back to me to answer all my queries does help with my situation.  They’ve even managed to sort out the delivery of the things I needed in such a short space of time , their efficient working ethics deserves to be mentioned. 

Not to forget that the clinical and non clinical  staff at 9 E and 9 F have all been commendable. Thanks for all the care that I had received .

title: Kind,caring service.
body:
I received a warm greeting, both over the telephone and in person.

I felt valued as a patient.  The ladies listened to my enquiry and were able to help.

Exceptional service.

title: Dr never called
body: Phoned for urgent telephone appointment as I had been monitoring my blood pressure and noticed a high rise to 213/103 told dr would call later that day. Well it’s now7:45pm and I’ve had no call maybe high blood pressure is not important to them now ! Not happy at all a A&E visit may be my only option if it doesn’t lower

title: Best doctors Dr Tahir & Dr Farah
body: I must say best doctors they listen their patients very nicely and excellent approach towards the patients very humble attitude in the whole surgery its pleasure to meet both great personality.

title: Efficient
body: Rang 8.30am took 15 mins to talk to reception and seen by the doctor at 9.30am. No long phone queue, saw an actual doctor. Much better than my last practice.

title: Efficient and caring
body:
I had an appointment to have a mole seen to. The dermatologist and her assistant were very caring, efficiënt and had the immediate support of one of the senior members of the team to check my mole. I felt very much at ease that they treated me well and have the right plan going forward.

Also it was very calming to have the aquarium displayed in the waiting room on the screen. Thank you. I wish they have this in other departments too.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent treatment
body: I attended the Widnes Spamedica for both cataracts and cannot fault the treatment. The staff are kind and patient. The place is spotlessly clean and gives you confidence. I would highly recommend.

title: Rubbish practice
body: I have ongoing issues with feet and back which make it difficult to walk in a postman so need these to be work I have asked three times of I can be clclassifed as disabled which would help work wise but the gentleman refused to answer the question not allowed to speak with go practice manager uncaring unhelpful

title: Very good
body: On time friendly and sympathetic. Understood problem and put an action plan in place. Only downside will be the waiting time for the referral

title: Upsetting Service at Reception
body:
I received a really good service from receptionist 1 in the morning who was willing to help (get me an appointment through unofficial ways) she said, "only because you're nice"... I mean, that's lucky for me I guess!? 

Receptionist 2 later that day, and here's what I got after I was after some further assistance, quite the contrast. And I quote: "I can't be bl***y doing with this!". "Rude?! I am not rude!". "No I won't tell you my name - Go find out yourself...go on". "Oh go make a complaint then" and "Byeee" in a mocking tone. 

Really upsetting, confusing, concerning. How can NHS staff be like this to a (and I quote) "nice" person? And seriously, niceness or not, it's irrelevant. I was a person in need of care. I feel uncomfortable to go back now for care there. I also feel like a formal complaint would not be taken seriously, as she sounded very confident in her ability to be such a bully to a patient without consequence. So many reviews online about the same type of thing happening time and time again.

title: Fantastic hospital
body: I have been having physiotherapy at Leatherhead for the past few weeks and it has been great; the service, the professionalism, the friendliness, not to mention free parking! I have attended Leatherhead hospital for other things in the past and will always asked to be referred there whenever possible. Keep up the great work...NHS at it's best! :)

title: Amazing
body:
Been with this practice for 20 years now.

The doctors here have seen me through some of the toughest and most worrisome times of my life and never let me down.

Can honestly say I would be devastated if it ever stopped operating.

Big thank you to all the practice staff for their hard work over the years.

title: Brilliant Service.
body: I have had a number of encounters as a patient with the Armada Surgery recently & cannot comment highly enough regarding all the staff, service & support offered .  As we are all aware the NHS are struggling & under pressure, but if you are prepared to adapt & perhaps assist yourself in visiting the reception  "in person" for appointment availability when the surgery opens , perhaps this may avoid "special privilege expectations" by the few. I cannot imagine the Armada Team will miss these selected individuals in their fantasy quest elsewhere for preferential service. Theres always the Private sector. Good Luck.. Thanks Armada...

title: Great practice
body: very helpful & efficient service as usual. The staff are an asset to the practice. If you are unhappy with your current practice this is the practice to go to.

title: Highly recommend
body: Couldn’t ask for a better service for not only me but my toddler, I had an appointment within a couple of hours and could start his medication that evening, gives me peace of mind knowing he can be seen quickly. Doctor was kind and helpful

title: Excellent care
body: I cannot thank the staff at Highfield hospital enough for their care and attention whilst I was a patient. Nothing was ever too much trouble for them and I felt very confident being able to ask them anything. The staff put me completely at ease, they were very friendly and the care I received was second to none.

title: Caring GP
body: I recently had to see a GP due to an acute problem. I was given a face to face appointment on the same day. The GP was very caring, listening carefully to all of my symptoms. She was very efficient, promptly referring me on for further investigations. I was very grateful for her considerate care.

title: Wonderful practice!
body:
I have been a GP for 30yrs and have recently joined this practice. After having had a few visits, I can confidently say the level of professionalism is fantastic. 
Very efficient, kind and caring. Just today I saw a nursing assistant who was superb, as were all the reception staff. Makes me proud of the good old NHS!

title: Neglectful, rough treatment
body: I was kept waiting 5 hours in A and E without painkillers with torn muscles and a broken bone. That's Mid-Staffs bad. The discharge notes were dangerously and wildly inaccurate. This hospital is not safe for A and E.

title: Horrendous care and service
body: Turned up to A&E with a doctor's referral, triaged in an hour told I'd be seen by surgical within a couple of hours. Currently 8 and half hours later and nothing - not seen anyone triaged or taken through to a doctor in a good few hours! I think it's poor management and also need to make sure the staff know how to provide good customer service!

title: Excellent.
body:
I’ve been under the care of the glaucoma tram at Manchester Royal Eye for many years, having also had two trabs and  also having a recent cataract op. 
These guys are absolutely top notch. The care is outstanding. 
I feel totally confident leaving my sight in their safe hands.

title: Absolutely wonderful caring practice
body: Treatment received from making appointment getting text remind to signing in then seeing GP of your choice. Wow 10/10 caring maintains dignity & respect at all times. Always going that extra mile. A credit to NHS

title: Fantastic job
body: Reception staff work hard and are very polite. My appointment was with a nurse at the practice for a general health check, she was friendly, polite and very efficient. Very impressed with the surgery as a whole.

title: Great practice
body: It was good it made me more of aware of the dangers of alcohol. In the future I will definitely be more sensible with my alcohol consumptio.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Quick & helpful service
body: I attended the drop-in x-ray service, expecting a long wait. I was pleasantly surprised to be seen within minutes. Staff were pleasant, helpful, and, most importantly, deaf-aware. I would recommend this service.

title: Excellent Family Medicine Practice
body: The GPs are very helpful. The nurses are also helpful. The admin staff are good too. Overall, the surgery is professional and empathetic towards my family medical needs.

title: Medical report
body: Handed in a medical report form to be filled in . Told would take up to 28 days . Well over 28 days told report is on doctors desk waiting to be so signed 2 weeks ago. Finally after chasing  sent sars report  which I don’t really need . Paid through bacs and still waiting. Absolutely ridiculous.

title: Great Hospital With Great Staff
body: This Hospital is the best i have been to in my life(67 years old) i went in for a full hip replacement which was a complete success the whole team who did my operation i would like to thank individually if i could  this Hospital is so clean you could eat your dinner off the floor well done to everyone involved in keeping this the Best Hospital it can possibly be just perfect I would  really like to thank  the surgeon who did my operation great result and no pain at all please thank him for me

title: Nice homely practise
body: The doctor called me and discussed my yearly review of medication! She seemed very interested in what the medication was for and discussed each one with me! it was a very pleasant experience!

title: Bad practice / rude doctor
body:
I visited this hospital yesterday. I started to tell the doctor the history of my pain and then I said to him "they made an MRI for my back ..", before I finish my sentence, the Doctor suddenly shouted at me and said don't tell me about the diagnosis. I said I'm telling you what happened in my case I'm not a doctor to tell diagnosis. He kept shouting, I then stopped talking and said " seriously?!" . Then I said to him I already told you about the pain and as you said you have no previous papers about my case I'm tellibg what happened. Then during the visit he was reading from his computer from all my previous papers (he was literally not telling the truth at the begining).
The doctor was then talking about something totally different from my case ( he mentioned shorter leg and tilted neck without evidence!!!) , he never talk about my case except that he said, Yes, you have disk but all of the people has disk !!! He said he got more than 10 disks!!! He think this is something not important to treat and he exactly said "you don't need me"

 Really? I was waiting for this appointment for 2 years suffering from severe pain. 

He refers me back to Orthopedic which it needs now more time to wait until an appointment with ortho to see me and refer me to treatment again. 
This is really unacceptable and inconvenient.

The clinic reception and the staff in the clinic are all very rude And unhelpful except of the nurse that was helping to be a chaperone, she is nice.

The doctor asked me to make some movements to check and I did them and he supposed to know these are not good movements in my case as I didn't sleep all night because of the pain in my back and couldn't even move to get pain killer (I live with my children only and they were sleeping). I am in a severe pain now while today is weekend and no GPs. Nearest walking requires me to drive or walk to bus which I can not do now because of the pain after my hospital visit yesterday. 
The doctor should have known moves he asked me to do will bring bad pain to my back.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: A disgrace
body:
Despite being told I would be contacted  to confirm an appointment I have, again, been left without any contact from the practice. I was told on Monday I would be contacted later in the week to confirm an appointment for the following Monday. I hadn't heard anything by mid afternoon on the Friday so contacted the surgery to confirm. I was told I would be contacted later Friday to confirm.  Needless to say, I still haven't heard anything and it is Saturday morning. I have booked Monday off work but have no indication as to whether I will be seeing a doctor or not.  Not the first time this has happened.  My confidence in this practice is non existent and it is incredibly unnerving to feel you don't have access to a Doctor. 
Why it takes over an hour to answer the phone is inexplicable to me.  This practice is very poorly managed and I would certainly not recommend anyone tying to join.  
Very, very poor.

title: Dont care
body:
Came by ambulance had ecg wanst told if results ok...was asked if in pain i said yrs nothing was offered by staff.waited 7 hours with chest pain...was in waiting area and 5 people was in front of me and then 6 people came after me and were treated and left hospital 7 hours later im still there i had to tell doctor i had  to leave as i live in runcorn and on benefits and couldnt afford a taxi on tarriff 2 but no care or empathy or solution was offered to me and the doctor was like ok you go if you want....so i still have chest pain but no one cares...no wonder they get diagnoses wrong
And the admin staff omg talk about attitude if you dont do customer service love then go work in factory

title: Very poor service
body: Fortunately I have not had the cause to see the doctor regularly for the 4 years I have been with the practice. My use of their services is mainly for my repeat prescription which when requested is never issued to the pharmacy on time resulting in me at the eleventh hour trying to get my medication. The surgery blame the pharmacy, but having tried different chemists on other occasions they all blame this surgery, it seem to be their process of signing by the doctor is breaking down.I appreciate they are busy but a simple request should be managed much better.

title: “Exceptional volume of calls”
body:
How can the number of calls be exceptional when you can never get through? It needs to say “once again we are inundated with calls because we can’t cope, you can keep trying but you probably won’t get through” 

I have been trying daily for weeks for an appointment for my 5yo and I am yet to even get in a queue.  Yesterday I went to the practice in person only to be rudely addressed and told to come back again because there was nothing next week. 

This is beyond ridiculous. Where are we supposed to go? What are we supposed to do? They haven’t updated their practices for 30 years. What business do you know of where you can’t book online? 
These antiquated methods need to change. Absolutely disgusting.

title: Customer focused and responsive service
body: They are always willing to help and very quick at getting back to their clients. My issue was dealt with very quickly and very professionally and I was informed about the process and all the way through

title: Wonderful Staff
body: I have an internal gynaecology procedure at Lanesborough Wing and the staff were absolutely fantastic. I don’t find these scans easy and as soon as they heard that I was uncomfortable one nurse did the scan and the other came and chatted to me. Asked me questions and generally put me completely at ease. I can’t really express how brilliant they were and during a very vulnerable procedure I left the room completely calm and relaxed. Wonderful hospital and wonderful staff.

title: Problem sorted
body: Please disregard my last review Dr called me at 8 pm I had no idea the Dr’s worked so late after surgery closed and thought i had been forgotten. Problem all sorted now and such a lovely Dr

title: Good practice that lets itself down
body: Appointment booked for 9.10 and didn’t get seen until 10.10. I had received a text 6 weeks prior to this appointment to book an appointment with a certain Dr. 6 weeks of trying to get in with said Dr and it was impossible. Can only book same day appointments by the time I got through they had always gone on that day. In the end I just booked an appointment with another Dr and then my appointment was an hour late. I have work, this is not acceptable. Doctors and nurses themselves are lovely but they need to sort out not being able to pre book appointments and certainly should never levee someone waiting for an hour when they have an appointment.

title: Providing a fabulous service to our community
body:
Good Morning,

I just wanted to drop you a note to say thank you. I know people don’t always say it enough sometimes. 

I haven’t had cause to use the doctors for several years and have been to see you or spoken to the one of your lovely doctors 3 times in the last couple of weeks for three separate things. 

Each time you have managed to squeeze me in for an appointment, which I have appreciated knowing how stretched you all are. Everyone I have spoken to including reception has shown me great kindness, care, taken the time to listen to me and most importantly reassure me about my various aliments. 

In particular, I met Nurse Claire on Friday. She was lovely and took the time to explain what was going on and to reassure me. 

Everyone is so busy these day and I just wanted to say thank you, you are all providing a fabulous service to our community.

title: Disappointing
body: Had a recent hip replacement. Consultant suggested that I get in touch with my GP for a district nurse appointment to check on dressing if they did not contact me. I called and an appointment was made. I realised later that I could not make this appointment and called again to rearrange. The receptionist was puzzled as to why I was calling and asked me if I had a number for district nurses. Unhelpful. I asked who district nurses worked for and was told ' I don't know' I suggested Community Care, no response. I informed the receptionist about my consultant's request to contact my GP and that I had arranged the consultation through Wake Green Surgery. Having a hip replacement meant I was in pain and immobile and I found the receptionists training lacking somewhat. Thankfully the receptionist suggested I leave it with her and she would get back to me. She did, promptly by text saying that she had mailed secretaries but could not guarantee that my appointment could be changed. I texted back, can't. Rubbish service. This is very frustrating. So, a district nurse may come out to me when I am unavailable wasting their time and tax payers money and possibly creating a 'did not attend' mark against my name which would be false.  I was giving 48 hours notice of request change.

title: Still no way near to being better. Useless service
body: I had 1 face to face physio appt (lock down was video appts which lead to wrong diagnosis) during face to face appt physio wasn't sure if I needed an injection or rehab. Was told if I didn't feel rehab was doing anything or was in too much pain to do excerises to phone up, and request injections and explain why. After 1st rehab pain got worse. And was off work for 35 days. Phoned up, explained situation. Was told they'd email physio and phone me back. Never reccieved a phone call. 2 weeks later I phoned back and was told I had to go to rehab. My shoulder is still no better. And haven't had another appt. It's too expensive to get there, and I now have a couple of knee problems. And am waiting for a orthopedic appt to come through. My shoulder started 2yrs ago. I found service to be very bad. If physio had phoned me like I'd originally requested. Then I'd have been able to explain situation, and maybe I'd have had injections by now. And be able to do exercises. I've now been discharged, and am in a worst place than before I was referred. I wouldn't recommend this service to anyone.

title: Such kindness and care
body:
We visited A and E Friday 23rd March.I was triaged, seen by a kind and professional doctor, given medication,helpful advice and booked  into the orthopedic centre for the next morning 
We were really surprised how quickly we were seen and delighted with the caring treatment.How pressurised were they as well, with ambulances arriving with new patients .
Our experience in the orthopedic centre was the same: efficient and kind doctor.,radiographer and nursing staff.
We cannot praise enough the excellent service we received.Thank you!

title: great caring practice
body: i recently had a steroid injection into my knee for painful arthritis. the doctor made me fully aware of all the pros and cons of this proccedure. The doctor was extremely careful in preparation. I cannot fault the cheerful disposition and caring manner. The staff always do their best to give you an appointment. I feel very lucky to belong to this practice.

title: Very kind and caring service
body: Hubby was having symptoms that could have been a heart attack - he was taken care of at the surgery and follow up arranged immediately.  They couldn't have done any more.  Thank you.

title: Poor standard of care
body:
Very disappointed with my experience at this practice.
I called them at 8am to book a telephone appointment and my call wouldn't go through as it said line busy. When I finally got through at a quarter past 8 I was told there were no more telephone appointments.

I filled in an e-consult for my problems and I got a phone call soon after - which was probably the best part of my whole experience - asking me to come in for a face to face appointment with the nurse that day.

I come into the practice at my appointment time and there is a 15 minute wait after my scheduled time before the nurse calls my name. This is not something I would have minded as I understand that GP practices are busy but the NP didn't even bother to smile at me. I smiled at her several times and she just sort of ignored it. There was no attempt at making me feel comfortable or welcome in the practice and I felt awkward and like I was just using up her time. I know NHS staff are stressed but there should at least be an attempt at establishing patient rapport.

She immediately started off by saying that two of the problems I had could not be seen by the GP practice and I had to use other services, and she spent a little bit of time talking about my third problem but it seemed like she was more interested in closing the consultation - I want to point out that it was only at this point she seemed friendlier towards me. 

There was no attempt to examine me and I felt like my concerns weren't even properly engaged with. I don't understand why this could not have been a telephone appointment. This could all have been done over the phone since she didn't even take a look at me, which I very much would have thought to be part of the consultation. To be made to come into the surgery and wait while ill, only to have a brief and fairly cold consultation seems like a massive waste of both my time and hers. This was a very very frustrating experience for me.

As someone who is a member of the healthcare profession myself, I was surprised and disappointed. I personally would not treat my patients like this.

title: Disappointment
body: My GP practice referred me for an ultrasound.  I attended for that and was pleased to hear everything was ok.  However, the person who conducted my ultrasound was rude and quite obviously had no social skills.  I've only have good experiences with Musgrove and this was the first time I had come across such a rude person.

title: Day care surgery
body: I attended this department on Friday 24 March for an operation to mend my broken wrist. I was terrified when I arrived but was soon put at ease by the kind, caring, professionalism from every member of staff I came into contact with. I felt that I was listened to as an individual which was so reassuring. The staff on this unit, theatre staff and recovery room staff all deserve a special mention. Thank you each and every one of you- I couldn’t have been treated any better if I had paid privately (which I couldn’t afford to do anyway!). I certainly wouldn’t be terrified of attending in the future.

title: Surely the Best GP Surgery you can find in…
body:
Surely, this has to be the “Best GP Practice in Huddersfield”, if ever there was such a title. I have just come off a call with my Dads GP this morning, who has been following up my father for the last 6 months following an unexpected illness, he has been so incredibly supportive to us as have the rest of the practice team.
My father has been a lifelong patient of this practice, and it was evident that it was struggling with the previous team of GPs over a few years ago. Since then, it has transformed unrecognisably, with a new team of GPs coming in and overhauling the practice.The Grange GP Surgery now have the nicest team of incredibly professional, kind & caring GPs, Nurses and a wonderfully fresh team of reception staff (they have got rid of the previous “Rottweilers”, and “GP blockers”) . The current team have been wonderfully pleasant, timely and efficient in all of my dealings over my Dad . Keep up the great work and my thanks for the wonderful care you give .

title: Excellent experience from start to follow up
body: I was very pleased with the efficient service and quality of advice given. The doctor my daughter saw was kind, knowledgeable and very approachable.

title: Excellent Experience
body: Delighted with the MRI scanning experience this morning. My husband has claustrophobia and was extremely anxious about the scanner. All staff were reassuring & patient in the extreme . Would like to thank them all as they went over & above to ensure all went positively & that we were listened to ! Many thanks

title: Well Impressed
body:
Just walked in. No appointment or anything. 
I was greeted with respect and dignity. 
I only had to wait just over an hour to be seen and treated. 
How impressive is that?
Try getting that sort of service from your GP. 
If I wore a hat I’d take it off to all who work there. 
You can say what you like but the NHS is the best in the world. 
You have my thanks.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Really good GP
body:
E-consults are fast and efficient.
Everyone at Elms Medical Centre is extremely helpful.
Thank you for all your hard work!

title: Pleasant experience
body: Was very nervous about having my cataract removed but from reception through all the tests , the surgeon and recovery staff, I found every one very friendly helpful and they put me at ease. It was a pain free procedure and can't wait to have my other eye done.

title: Incredible service today 5*
body: My daughter (17) saw a doctor today. She’s waited a couple of weeks for the appointment but it was definitely worth the wait for a reassuring, thorough and unhurried appointment. She said afterwards, “I’ve never had an appointment like that before. He explained everything and now I understand everything. I wanted to cry when I left the appointment as it was a huge weight lifted off my shoulders. He was so kind and I had a really long appointment. If I need another appointment I’m definitely asking for him.”

title: Excellent practice
body: Staff very friendly doctors and ANP nurses very good and pleasant to talk to. I had appointment for Friday 24th march regards my bloods the lady rang me and explained everything to me about results very satisfied so I would like to say a big thank you to everybody.

title: Good experience
body:
I have had two cataract operations at Barnsley, the second one at an extra Saturday clinic. On both occasions the nursing staff were friendly and reassuring, and the surgeon was careful, very thorough and very efficient.
Before the first operation I was very nervous, but because of a good experience on that day I went into the second operation without any fears at all. Excellent teamwork from everyone there.

title: Great practice
body: I have been a patient of this practice all my life .I have to go for treatment every 3 months I get a reminder to make an appointment.i ring in non busy time i.e not early morn and I never have a problem getting through the reception staff are always helpful  and try to fit appointments round my work. The GPS have always taken the time to listen .the nurses have always been friendly and caring the nurse I usually see is an advanced practice nurse she is always friendly but still professional,she is very knowledgeable and thorough and will additional information and advice if needed.i have always been treated with kindness and respect by all staff members

title: Great practice
body: I was very anxious about my cataract surgery but I was put at ease by the lovely staff at spa medica Newcastle staffs they went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and cannot thank them enough

title: Extremely polite
body: I arrived 15 mins early but was seen within 5 minutes of arrival. Staff were very polite and helpful. Would thoroughly recommend this clinic.

title: Regular Excellence
body: I have been receiving care and treatment in the Cardiology Department over several years, the last being an overall cardiac examination with various members of staff. I have received excellent care and friendly kindness always, over several years.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent!
body: Great practice where you are given time and are not rushed. So much better than my last practice. Great practice and I must also add that the adjoining pharmacy is also excellent

title: Needs closing
body:
I personally left this Dr's at the beginning of 2022 due to rude staff and never being able to get an appointment, I felt like my health care needs were not being met, as I am diabetic and was having issues with my periods and my diabetes not being monitored accordingly.

Today 21/03/2023 I called at 8am to make an appointment for my mother who has Motor Neuron Disease and cannot look after herself. I was on hold for 3 hours. And then when I did finally get to speak to the receptionist I got told mid april is the next appointment. Or I could call back tomorrow and "try my luck". This sorry excuse for a drs surgery is failing it's duty of care. They are no longer capable of caring for their patients. Their staff are mostly rude, unhelpful and over half of the receptionist don't know a knee from an elbow. For example my mum needed an open ended sick note, I got told that I would need certain documents from her Dr at the hospital, I got the documents and they still refused to do the sick note that she was more than entitled to due to her Motor Neuron Disease progression making her disabled and unable to look after herself let alone work. She also had a Dr refuse her tests when trying to find out what was wrong with her (she should have been booked in for an mri at the very least). A Dr also told her that taking one of the medications she's on would do nothing for her due to it being a small dose, my mother stopped taking that medicine due to that remark by the Dr and ended up in hospital a week later due to symptoms from not taking the medication.

title: Pretty good practice
body:
I have only been to the surgery a few times but reception staff have always been friendly and helpful although can be frustrating when there is a queue and only one person working but 6 people behind the screen who don’t come to help. 
Nurses have always been lovely. 
Hard to get an appointment but that’s the same everywhere. 
My only real complaint is that on my last gp visit I felt very rushed and at times felt like he wasn’t listening to what I was saying properly

title: Vine medical
body: Found the whole booking procedure unhelpful had a letter to say book an appointment so went to surgery on two separate occasions to be told no appointments available, had to get daughter to book one on line which was not easy, seems that the whole Doctors appointment system needs looking at, I feel it is now run as a business not a health care provider, but the HCA that I saw very professional and a Credit to Vine just a shame that the procedure to get to see her so very difficult

title: Appalling service attitude all profit not…
body: I and my family have been at this practice for several years, this practice has an Incestuous drive for profit over genuine over patient care, I know many of the doctors do a good job but behind that, this practice is one of the top earning practices in the region for should I call the rewards from pharmaceutical representatives, so this mean any given opportunity to prescribe medication they will, I will  say taking such monies certainly puts a different spin of a persons genuine care for that patient, this information is available via uk government both my children have been given medication in the past 12 months that really should not have been given or a lot further checks and information should have been given to myself around potential effects but before it was what I would call thrown at my family with the attitude this will solve the problem, when I questioned this with the practice team I would what I describe as slapped down and questioned what do I really know above our practice, well I will say I know my children and both has suffered due to your practice not giving myself the Information needed for my children's best care, If you notice on all the negative reviews on different platforms very few are replied too but good or ok reviews are given a response, the amount of negative comments around the attitude towards patients concerns is shocking, I can certainly vouch for this in my dealing with the office staff, please do you homework when dealing with this practice, ask all the questions you need to make sure it is correct for you, again I will say it is only over the last few years I feel this practice has gone like this so I am sure some of the GPs still in this practice are great but when its about ill patients it should be care and empathy at every interaction not attitude and profit, this is my experience

title: A credit to our NHS
body:
I recently attended the Rookery Medical Centre and really wanted to write a good review, as I think people are too quick to complain but not to offer appreciation, when credit is due.
On this occasion and in the years I have been a patient at the Rookery, I cannot fault the service and the truly amazing staff who work there.
This week the two different reception staff I spoke to, were so friendly, kind, empathetic, upbeat and helpful. As the faces of the practice I imagine they suffer a lot of challenging people, negativity and demands. I genuinely think they are angels to remain so positive and cheerful despite the day to day pressures of the role and that working in Primary Care brings. And this sentiment extends to the Doctors and nursing staff, HCAs, pharmacists and generally everyone I have encountered at the practice over the years.
My appointment I had this week with the Doctor, was such a positive experience and reflective of how great our NHS can be. He had a wonderful bedside manner - I did not feel rushed, he was very thorough and spent quite a considerable about of time (given how stretched things are) to understand my problems. He spent a lot of time explaining things so I understood them and made sure I knew & was clear with what the plan was going forward. And I have to say this has always been my experience of the practice, whichever GP, Nurse or HCA that I have seen.
I find the phone consultations helpful and convenient for minor things and they have always given face to face appointments if necessary, or when I have really felt concerned.
At a time when the NHS/GP’s are overworked and face a lot of criticism, I cannot fault the Rookery Medical Centre. I have been a patient there for many years; since my childhood, my children are now patients and they have always gone above and beyond, whoever I have dealt with. And in terms of my children, I have always been reassured that I am not an “overreacting mum” and they will always see my kids if i feel really concerned. I cannot express how much of a comfort this is for any parent, that we are being listened to and taken seriously.
Brilliant practice, amazing staff, well run and an absolutely credit to our NHS.

title: Worst practise
body: Walked into surgery with a serious issue requesting docs appointment. As they are quite busy i was given an appointment for approximately 11 days after initial request was made. Waited. Eventually was told three days before appointment that consultation would be over the telephone. As I was in a bad way I went hospital instead. Receptionist was asked if any more appointments become available before scheduled date of I could be considered as it was quite urgent. Was told unequivocally that this could be arranged. Nothing was arranged of course as this was an empty promise. Never had any problems with this surgery ever. Thus is the first time and I was left so disappointed that I had to leave a review. Really disappointed with the service provided.

title: Booking a telephone call
body: I am told the engaged tone only occurs when 15 people are in the telephone queue  This is difficult to reconcile with the engaged tone seconds after 8am. Something is wrong with this booking system. Something is wrong here. Would increasing the number of people in the queue work? This is not an acceptable service at the moment

title: Disappointing appointment with Nurse
body: I recently attended my practice provisionally for a diabetes review, I have had a couple of these before with a person who, regrettably is no longer with the practice.  Unfortunately, I found her replacement not to be anything like as helpful as she was.  Her manner being very abrupt and over efficient and not a friendly easy experience for myself.  She did not face me when asking questions but rather had her eyes on the screen in front of her.  I feel she needs to practice her personal skills and interact with patients more .

title: Atrocious
body: I waited on the phone for 36 minutes,  when I first in queue, I was cut off. This happens regularly. You cannot see a GP face to face. They ask for photos. Some GPS can be abrupt. I didn't get results from scan, even though they were sent to surgery. Many patients have left and registered with a different practice. Stay clear.

title: Prompt action
body: Requested medical revue at 1115 and given appointment with paramedic practitioner at Tanworth Lane 4 hours later. Excellent service

title: The worse practice
body: I have a baby 2 weeks old . I give to them the documents for registration, after 3 days my midwife told me to go with the baby at the go to be checked about the chest , and something what the baby’s had on his tongue. I call the practice and they said they can’t find the baby , and they said they can’t see the baby because is not registered. I said but it a baby two weeks old . And the midwife said they are not allowed to say no to can check a newborn baby . This is not first time when they do like that . I have another baby 1 year and 3 months old , she don’t was feel okay and she had a swallow on the right side of the belly, I was know is something for the go not for emergency because the baby was okay, playing not fever nothing. But they never have any appointments available. I called from 8:00 o clock and me and my husband thinking that one of us will can make an appointment I stay on phone until 8:30 they answer and they said they don’t have any appointments Available. I said it a second day when I call from 8 o clock in the morning and never they don’t have any appointments available, I said is a one year baby old , is not normal to call 2 days continuously for an appointment. I call 111 they said to call the gp , I said the gp don’t want to see her , I go emergency I stay 2 hours just to can be in the end send to the gp on the hospital where I was need to wait 4 hours again to see someone my daughter. Because is not emergency what she had is for gp . I go to the gp practice again and try to make a complaint because is not ok what they do . The doctor from the gp practice are good , the problem is the receptionist, they are rude in the phone sometimes.

title: Fabulous service
body:
I attended the Rheumatology dept on the 23rd March and saw my usual consultant. 
The service this department delivers is nothing short of miraculous. They have looked after me for 10 years now, always there when I need them. Appointments are on time, the staff are efficient and friendly at all times and I can't thank them enough for their exemplary care.

title: Warm and welcoming
body: Kindness is uppermost here.  I am surprised at other reviews I have read here.  Patient care and understanding the issues of a sick individual are clearly appreciated and there is never a problem getting an appointment.  If you have missed the slots in the morning surgery, there is always another chance in the afternoon.  Reception staff are keen to listen and will make a note for afternoon staff to facilitate this process. Always listen to the explanation given if you have not managed to get through for 20 minutes and realise demand is high. Explain calmly why you need attention, so the ball is rolling in a positive direction.  The workers here do there best and they are human too.

title: Blood test
body:
I had a routine blood test. I am always very nervous but the practice nurse was very reassuring and competent. She put me at my ease and did the procedure without pain or bruising.
The permanent doctor at the practice picked up an abnormality immediately and requested a repeat blood test. 
The receptionist went out of her way to fit me in for the second blood test. This was carried out by the same phlebotomist with the same faultless experience.
I have been lucky enough to have good health so my experience of the surgery is limited but, based on my experiences over the last two weeks, I am really pleased and grateful for their prompt and caring responses.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I had occasion to visit Urgent Care in Newark Hospital, not life-threatening but nonetheless of concern.  The staff (2 nurses) who dealt with me were wonderful, all smiles and a little light chatter to calm the nerves while necessary tests were completed, but compassionate and empathetic.  These are the 'real' face of the NHS, caring and thoughtful.  Thank you so much for putting my mind at rest. The middling review of 'same sex accommodation' is solely because I have no idea what the arrangements are, simply that I was treated as I would wish everyone to be treated.

title: Nurse
body:
I had an cholesterol blood test done. 
First time meeting the nurse, she was very friendly and helpful. I felt I was listened to,and was given good advice.

title: Same day emergency care centre amazing!
body: I was sent to Sdec yesterday by my Gp,as I walked in I was greeted with friendly busy staff who showed me where to be, within minutes I had bloods taken and a friendly female doctor came and talked to me . She examined me, took a full history and told me of her plan for a DVT scan and an chest X-ray. I then got a much needed cup of tea! A care assistant took me for my scan ,then I went for my X-ray and back to Sdec All the staff from all departments were kind and caring. After a short wait the doctor returned with all my results ,explained everything to me .I had arrived at the hospital at 14.00 and at 16..30 I was on my way home with my medication, truly amazing. The efficiency of that department is the best I’ve ever seen,every member of staff was busy but still took the time to be patient and understanding when asked questions.I cannot think of enough words of praise  so Thankyou to all concerned.

title: Great practice
body: It was good it made me more of aware of the dangers of alcohol. In the future I will definitely be more sensible with my alcohol consumptio.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Horrible rude receptionist
body: Arrived 8 minutes late for a scan because of horrendous traffic at the bakers Arms and lea Bridge Road and was told I won't be seen for being 8 mins late  8 mins  the receptionist was  rude with a attitude problem  the place it self is filthy could do with being knocked down and rebuilt I would strongly advise anyone who need to go for a scan go else where
